com.camerontec.util.pool

Class UnboundedReferencePool<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.pool.UnboundedReferencePool<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The referent type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IReferencePool<T>

    public final class UnboundedReferencePool<T>
extends Object
implements IReferencePool<T>
    An unbounded reference pool implementation which guarantees no garbage generation.

    This implementation is never exhausted as new entries are created as necessary, however, they are tracked and so never become available for garbage collection. Clients must ensure that checked out objects are eventually checked back in when no longer required in order to avoid excessive memory. The checkInAll() method is supported for this purpose and is the most efficient way of checking back in all checked out references.

    This implementation uses a IReferentLifecycle to provide lifecycle hooks for referents during checkOut() and checkIn(PoolableReference).

    This implementation is not thread safe and in particular is not suitable for use when different threads checkOut() and checkIn(PoolableReference) elements respectively. Or stated another way, this implementation is only suitable for use when the same thread is responsible for both checking out and checking in elements.

      • checkInAll

        public void checkInAll()
        Description copied from interface: IReferencePool
        Check in all references that are currently checked out of the pool.

        This is an optional operation and is only supported by implementations which track checked out references.

        Specified by:
        checkInAll in interface IReferencePool<T>
